intro: Cochlearia himalaica, commonly known as the Himalayan cochlearia, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many familiar plants such as cabbages and mustard. The plant produces small, white or purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are typically basal, rosette-forming, and covered in fine hairs to protect against cold and UV radiation. Cochlearia himalaica is adapted to harsh alpine environments, exhibiting resilience to low temperatures and strong winds.
